question: Which institution has recently entered the Limca Book of Records for the ‘Largest Zentangle Art’?
explanation: The Zentangle Method is an easy-to-learn, relaxing, and fun way to create beautiful images by drawing structured patterns. A 2,000-sq.ft. Artwork created in 2018 by the students of NIFT-TEA College of Knitwear Fashion, Tiruppur, has entered the Limca Book of Records for the ‘Largest Zentangle Art’. The artwork was created by 25 students from various departments of the college. Zentangle involves motifs and micro-detailings. Nearly 5,000 colour pencils were used for this project.
